title: Bug 6009: New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the 'Enclosing Type' field is not correctly populated for nested classes.
OB: When the new class wizard is opened and the 'Enclosing Type' option is checked, the field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor when the new class wizard is opened and the option is checked.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a .java file in the editor. 
2. Click the new class button. 
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' option. 
4. Verify that the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank instead of being populated with the current type in the editor.
